Metadata: Scanning electron microscopic study of rockfish preserved at either ambient temperature or by isothermal freeze-fixation

Fresh rockfish (Bocaccio, "Sebastus paucispinis") fillets were blast frozen and later chemically fixed, at either ambient temperature or isothermally, at their respective storage temperatures (-5 deg. C or -20 deg. C). Isothermally freeze-fixed specimens showed better the degree of crushing and distortion of the muscle fiber, deposition of ice crystals in the cell membrane, and the multi-​dimensionality of connective tissue; they also better preserved fine detail. Thus, it appears to be the method of choice for studying the effects of freezing and frozen storage.
